Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bactridin-2 (Bact2, Bactridine 2; P-Mice-Antm-beta* NaTx14.8; Arthropods, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the long (4 C-C) scorpion toxin superfamily Sodiu
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus subtillis ICTA-07 (MIC=30 µM), Microccocus luteus ATCC 4698 (MIC=27 µM), Enterococcus faecalis WHO14 (MIC=65 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=54 µM), Yersinia enterocolitica ATCC 9610 (MIC=46 µM), Acinetobacter calcoaceticus ATCC 2305-5 (MIC=27 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Shows antibacterial activity against both Gram-positive bacteria (B.subtilis, M.luteus, E.faecalis) and Gram-negative bacteria (P.aeruginosa, Y.enterocolitica, A.calcoaceticus). Modifies membrane sodium permeability on Y.enterocolitica. Is toxic to mice, but is not to crabs. Induces concentration dependent haemolysis in human erythrocytes.
Sequence Information.PTM: Contains four disulfide bonds (By similarity) and C-terminal amidation.

Literature.Title: Antibacterial activity of six novel peptides from Tityus discrepans scorpion venom. A fluorescent probe study of microbial membrane Na+ permeability changes.
Literature.Author: Díaz P, D'Suze G, Salazar V, Sevcik C, Shannon JD, Sherman NE, Fox JW.

Literature.Title: Identification and phylogenetic analysis of Tityus pachyurus and Tityus obscurus novel putative Na+-channel scorpion toxins.
Literature.Author: Guerrero-Vargas JA, Mourão CB, Quintero-Hernández V, Possani LD, Schwartz EF.
